configstring.name: cvsps
configstring.desc: If you have cvsps installed, we can generate patchset information. You need at least version 2.0b6 of cvsps. Path to the cvsps executable, e.g. /usr/local/bin/cvsps

configstring.name: cvsps_home
configstring.desc: Directory where the .cvsps cache files can be created - it must be writeable by the webserver.

configstring.name: cvsgraph
configstring.desc: If you have CvsGraph installed, we can generate repository graphs. Path to the cvsgraph executable, e.g. /usr/bin/cvsgraph

configstring.name: svn_home
configstring.desc: Home directory for execution of svn binary (specified via --config-dir to svn). This directory must at least be readable to the webserver, otherwise svn will not work. If you leave this empty, the system's temporary directory will be used.

configstring.name: regexp
configstring.desc: You can define a regular expression, or an array of regexps, which if matched, will link a string to a ticket-tracking/bug-tracking system. The replacement is the second argument to preg_replace(), so you can backreference anything you match in the matching regexp. Example: '|bug:? #?(\d+)|i'

configsection.name: options

configstring.name: adminName
configstring.desc: The name displayed in the page footer. This is generally the name of the repository administrator.

configstring.name: adminEmail
configstring.desc: The email address displayed in the page footer.

configinteger.name: shortLogLength
configinteger.desc: In the directory view, a short summary of the last logentry is shown. The value here determines how many characters of this to show before truncating it, and appending '...' to indicate there is more to show.

configenum.name: defaultsort
configenum.desc: In the directory view, set a default sort order.

configsection.configenum:
Horde_Vcs::SORT_NAME
Horde_Vcs::SORT_NONE Horde_Vcs::SORT_AGE Horde_Vcs::SORT_NAME Horde_Vcs::SORT_REV Horde_Vcs::SORT_AUTHOR

configenum.name: urls
configenum.desc: Does your web server support mod_rewrite? If so, we can generate "pretty" URLs. If not, pathnames will be propagated using a GET variable instead.

configlist.name: restrictions
configlist.desc: If you wish to protect a file pattern on a global basis (i.e. across all sourceroots defined in backends.php) list the perl-style regex file patterns in this array. For example: '^/?CVSROOT'

configboolean.name: hide_restricted
configboolean.desc: If you wish to hide restricted files from listings as well as protect their contents, check this option, and restricted files will not be displayed in directory lists.

configenum.name: filename_linkto
configenum.desc: When clicking on a file name in the browse view, should we show the revision log, or display the most recent revision? The opposite action will be available when clicking on the revision number.

configboolean.name: caching
configboolean.desc: Allow caching of views? This requires that a caching backend be configured in Horde.

configmultienum.name: apps
configmultienum.desc: Select any applications that should be linked in Chora's menu
